title.rendered: 15 Best Things To Do In San Antonio

content.rendered:
Whether you’re visiting San Antonio for the first time, you’ve been here before, or even if you live or are planning to move here, the ‘most visited city in Texas’ always has a lot to offer. A city with a rich history and a colorful present, there’s plenty of cool things to do in San Antonio. So let’s get straight to it!

Related: Find rooms for rent in San Antonio

Here are the best things to do in San Antonio and what San Antonio tourism is best known for.

Explore the outdoors in San Antonio

1. Riverwalk

Looking for places to visit in San Antonio for a relaxing day out near the river, while you walk through paths lined with Cypress trees, restaurants, hotels, shops, museums, and more? Then put this one in your itinerary of the best things to do in San Antonio!

Costs:

Entry is free. Activities come with costs.

Timings:

The downtown and museum reach sections are open 24 hours a day. Individual business hours vary.

Visit the website
Plan your trip

2. Brackenridge Park

If you like spending time amongst nature, add this to your list of places to visit in San Antonio! You’ll find a 343 acre public park home to part of San Antonio river, a Japanese tea garden, a sunken garden theatre, events and much more. It’s the perfect place to enjoy a peaceful day out.

Costs:

Entry to the park is free. The pavilions reservations can cost up to $15 – $25 an hour.

Timings:

5:00 am – 11:00 pm

3. Natural Bridge Caverns

Never been inside a cave? Step into this one for an adventurous day out when looking for cool things to do in San Antonio! With different tours, from watching massive, otherworldly natural formations to mining for gems, fossils and other treasures, you’re in for a fun experience. (And don’t worry: this is one of the less scary caves!)

Costs:

$25 – $30

Timings:

9:00 am – 5:00 pm

Book Tickets
Visit the website

Enjoy the sports scene in San Antonio

4. iFly

If you’ve always wanted to fly, this is the ultimate add on to your cool things to do in San Antonio list. Defy gravity and soar indoors in a vertical wind tunnel! Sounds exciting, doesn’t it?

Costs:

Approximately $60 per person.

Timings:

Tuesday – Sunday: 11:00 am – 7:00 pm

Visit the website
Book tickets

5. Andretti indoor karting and games

If you’re an indoor sports geek, you’ll love to put this on your list of places to visit in San Antonio. From indoor karting and laser tag, to zip lines and VR adventures, you’ll get to do all this and more!

Costs:

Entry is free.

Timings:

12:00 pm – 11:00 pm on weekdays

11:00 am – 01:00 am on weekends

View Pricing
Plan an event

6. Tejas Rodeo Company

A live open rodeo event field with a steakhouse offering authentic outdoor food and drinks, along with live music and special events, this place couldn’t be more Texas! So if you’re looking for places to visit in San Antonio for a tasty meal and entertainment, head here!

They also host events and offer riding lessons to willing learners, ensuring there are plenty of cool things to do in San Antonio.

Costs:

$10 – $20 entry fee

Timings:

March through November

Book Tickets
Host an event

Visit the museums in San Antonio

7. Guinness World Records Museum

Into all things weird? Head to the Guinness World Records Museum to view exhibits of world records from amazing sports, human achievements, weirdness and more! You can also participate and earn an official Guinness World Record title, if you can break a record. Overall, this is one of the seriously cool things to do in San Antonio – don’t forget to take lots of photos!

Costs:

$15 – $24

Timings:

Sunday – Thursday: 11:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

Friday & Saturday: 10:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m.

Buy Ticket
Explore more

8. San Antonio Museum of Art

San Antonio tourism would be incomplete without wonders like these. Take a trip around the world and through 5,000 years of art at the San Antonio Museum of Art. It is renowned for ancient Greek, Roman & Egyptian art collections, and will engage your curious mind like no other.

Costs:

$10 – $20

Timings:

10:00 am – 05:00/07:00 pm

Event calendar
Shop

9. The Alamo

Looking for places to visit in San Antonio? Head to the Alamo for a historical and cultural trip in Texas. Discover more about historic buildings, artifacts, living history and beautiful gardens. You can also book a guided tour, history talk or a self guided audio tour when you’re here.

Tour costs:

$30 – $40

Tour timings:

Friday, Saturday & Sunday: 10:00 a.m., 11:30 a.m., 1:00 p.m.

Visit the website
Learn more

Get a taste of culture in San Antonio

10. Tobin Center for the Performing Arts

If you like both architecture and the arts, head to the Tobin Center for the Performing Arts that combines one of San Antonio’s most beloved architectural icons with advanced technology. The result: one of the most flexible multi-purpose performance halls in the United States!

Timings:

10:00 am – 06:00 pm; Sunday closed

Visit the website

11. RJA Ghost Tours

In the mood for something spooky when hunting for the best things to do in San Antonio? Then you’ll love the RJA Ghost Tours.

And just like it sounds, you get to relive the spooky past of the area, while listening to ghost stories and historical facts. Real locals will engulf you with their personal paranormal experiences and chill you to the core (in a good way.)

Costs:

$15 – $20

Timings:

09:00 pm

Visit the website
Book Tickets

12. Mission San Jose

Visit the beautiful historic facilities at the old mission San Jose when looking for the best things to do in San Antonio. You can visit the church, the historic cemetery and a beautiful garden that surrounds the structure.

Costs:

Free entry

Timings:

09:00 am – 05:00 pm

Reserve a tour
Event Calendar

Eat, drink and be merry (or shop) in San Antonio

13. The Barwalk

I strive to make each Barwalk a personal experience and conversation where more than a guide, I am a guy that you would want to have a drink with who just happens to enjoy a passion for history, storytelling, and sharing my hometown. – Founder of the Barwalk, Emzy King

And exactly as it sounds, you get to walk around the city, bar hopping while having a great time with people who know the place like no other.

Tour Costs:

$35 – $70

Timings:

Varies with the tour you choose

Book your tour
Visit the website

14. La Villita Historic Arts Village

One of the best places to visit in San Antonio: an artsy square block in the heart of downtown, this artisan village is a historic beauty that doubles up as a great shopping centre.

It includes over 25 shops and galleries showcasing local handmade goods, along with great many events throughout the year.

Timings:

Thursday – Saturday: 10:00 am – 06:00 pm; Sunday: 11:00 am – 04:00 pm

Visit the website
Shop

15. Market Square

Leave all the other places to visit in San Antonio behind, because the sights and flavors of old Mexico should be enough to entice you to head to the Historic market square – and keep you here. But to add to that, there are over 100 local businesses, live entertainment, and much more for everyone who visits.

Timings:

Saturday: 10am – 6pm

Sunday – Friday (Tuesday & Wednesday closed): 10am – 5pm

Visit the website

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find things to do in San Antonio? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match! Download the app here and hop on the easiest ride home, ever!

jetpack-related-posts.title: 5 Myths You Probably Believe About Living in Texas
jetpack-related-posts.author: Team Roomi
jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Texas has a reputation for many things. Namely for being big, cheap and friendly (And of course, the San Antonio urban legends.) In fact, these widely-held beliefs are, in part, the reason why Texas’s major metros are the fastest growing cities in the U.S. The Lone Star State is one…

Moreover, there's been subsequent decline of homeownership across multiple age groups in the last decade. Notably, older millennials are waiting longer than ever to take the leap into homeownership. They're…

Por otra parte, usualmente podrás encontrar todo tipo de tiendas, fondas,…

jetpack-related-posts.excerpt: Exploring a new city is always fun and exciting, especially in San Francisco, where there's something to do for everyone.
